definition: thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions

sentences.english: In the case of a company higher retained earnings will result in a lower dividend paid out to shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 在如此高的公司将被调低留存收益发放股利给股东。

sentences.english: GE said it intended to reduce its annual dividend to 6 cents per share from 19 cents.
sentences.chinese: 奇异公司宣称将要调降年度股利19分降为每股6分。

sentences.english: The effect of cash dividend initiations on the long-run market value of companies was studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了首次现金股利对上市公司长期价值的影响。

sentences.english: The dividend will fluctuate depending on the success or failure of the stock purchased.
sentences.chinese: 马卡斯很高兴看到他的股票投资每季有这么高的股利。

sentences.english: And the cash dividend has formed the cash flow which the shareholders received.
sentences.chinese: 而股利则形成了股东收入的现金流。

sentences.english: Thus, the dividend returns to stockholders all OR part of their paid-in capital investment.
sentences.chinese: 因此，该股利是对股东缴入资本的全部或部分偿还。

sentences.english: Dividends are payments by the corporation to equity shareholders based on an apportionment of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 股利是公司基于利润的分配而支付给资产股东的价款。

sentences.english: Formerly Cardinal Health's Pharmaceutical Technologies and Services Div .
sentences.chinese: 原红衣主教卫生医药技术和服务股利。

sentences.english: One firm would arrange the structure and handle dividend payments.
sentences.chinese: 由一家公司部署证券结构并支付股利。

sentences.english: The percentage of the percentage of state shares, are negatively related to cash dividend per share.
sentences.chinese: 国家股比例与每股现金股利存在负相关关系。

sentences.english: Blue chips generally pay dividends and are favorably regarded by investors.
sentences.chinese: 绩优股一般来说会分股利，受到投资者的欢迎。

sentences.english: This means you don't have to dilute profits by paying out dividends.
sentences.chinese: 这也意味着你不必因发放股利而减少利润。

sentences.english: These tools encouraged the CFC to shift its focus from abuse of market power to collusion.
sentences.chinese: 这些工具股利CFC将重心从市场力转向暗中勾结。

sentences.english: Solid dividend yields. Dividends have accounted for 42% of the total return of the market since 1926.
sentences.chinese: 自1926以来，股利占市场总收益的42%。

sentences.english: Lastly, if the state is non-equilibrium, the thesis also shows us the adjustive path.
sentences.chinese: 同时也讨论了非均衡状态下，股利政策的调整路径。

sentences.english: Agency costs and the pertinency of the dividend policy of the company.
sentences.chinese: 存在代理成本情况下公司股利政策的相关性研究。

definition: (economics) bonus stock or share, i.e. share issued fully or partly paid to an existing shareholder in a company, generally on a pro rata basis
interest (from an investment, esp. an endowment)
